title: STEM in SEM and Multiple Beam SEM: Past Achievements and Future Prospects
content: STEM-in-SEM, tSEM (or low voltage STEM (LVSTEM)) and multiple beam SEM (MBSEM) are two side branches of SEM that have received increasing attention over the past few years. These techniques address opposite ends of the SEM spectrum in terms of specimen size and image resolution. While LVSTEM is mostly focused on small area (100 mm2), and thin specimens (10â€™s of nm) imaged at nm scale resolution, MBSEM is used to rapidly collect images over large areas of bulk samples at image resolutions down to a few nm (about 1 hour for an area of 10 mm2). LVSTEM and MBSEM span a huge range of sample size and image resolutions and both methods present unique but different opportunities for imaging of a variety of specimens.
